Key Match Events: Jasprit Bumrah took 4 wickets in 7 overs, conceding 1 run per over.
Suryakumar Yadav scored 41 runs off 21 balls, hitting 3 fours and a six.
Kuldeep Yadav took 2 wickets for 31 runs in his 3 overs.
Arshdeep Singh almost took a hat-trick in his first spell but dropped a catch.
India won by 47 runs with a total of 181/8.
Noor Ahmad scored 12 runs off 18 balls, hitting 1 four and 1 six.
Rahmanullah Gurbaz was dismissed by Jasprit Bumrah for 16 runs.
Pre-Game Insights: India's batters performed well despite the tough batting conditions.
Ravindra Jadeja was expected to perform well due to the pitch conditions.
Kuldeep Yadav was called up to the XI for the Caribbean conditions.
Arshdeep Singh struggled in his first spell but recovered in the latter part of the innings.
India adopted a no-more-safety-first batting approach, which paid off.
Rohit Sharma took risks but scored 8 runs off 13 balls.
Post-Match Reflections: India's bowlers, particularly Jasprit Bumrah, played crucial roles in the victory.
Kuldeep Yadav's performance was a highlight, taking 2 wickets for 31 runs.
Arshdeep Singh showed promise but needs to improve his consistency.
India's strategy of adopting a fearless approach worked well in this match.
Rohit Sharma's risky approach continued but did not yield significant results.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The pitch offered good conditions for spinners, leading to wickets for India's spinners.
India's top-order batsmen, particularly Suryakumar Yadav, performed well under pressure.
Arshdeep Singh struggled initially but showed potential in the latter part of the innings.
Rohit Sharma's risky shots did not pay off, scoring only 8 runs off 13 balls.
